attributes.action: Make it law for sun tan lotions to show the Uva star rating on the packaging
attributes.background: The uva star rating provides us with the broad spectrum cover that the sun cream gives us. The EU standard is 3 star but advice is given that we should be looking for a 4 or 5 star. Many brands do not publish what their rating is so the consumer can not make an informed decision when buying.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bad.org.uk/for-the-public/skin-cancer/sunscreen-fact-sheet

attributes.action: Ban ice cream vans
attributes.background:
Ice cream vans are a nuisance to many people with their noise day after day, especially to housebound and those bringing up children who bear an additional burden of being pestered.

They are the least regulated of any trade in Britain, allowed door to door.

Putting up with them must end.
attributes.additional_details:
"Noise from ice-cream vans can be unwanted and intrusive." South Northamptonshire Council

"Noise from ice-cream vans is unwanted, intrusive and pollutes the environment in which we live in." Neighbours from Hell in Britain 

"aggressive selling.. should be banned" Noise Abatement Society

In 2014 in New York City alone: 1,804 complaints specifically about ice cream van music.

attributes.action: Introduce ‘Digital Judgement’ as a CORE topic in the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: Some outcomes of the internet boom are calls to fight, extremism terrorism and hatred and hoaxes, via new social media propaganda.  These threaten our society and children. It MUST be a priority now to arm our children with 'Digital Judgement'; the skill to cope with the threat of the digital world.
attributes.additional_details: Society is easily seduced by online propaganda, drawn towards anti-social intolerant attitudes and behaviours towards the extremes making governance virtually impossible and increasing risks and costs to individuals and communities.  Being able to recognise and resist internet threats is a crucial skill, but getting increasingly harder. We MUST start NOW educating our children to become ‘critical' users of the social media they will grow up with, and which will shape our society for evermore.

attributes.action: Set aside parliamentary time to debate banning petitions.
attributes.background: Petitions are becoming the bane of our existence. Hardly a day passes without some irritant imploring us to support one in a vain attempt to get the Government to do something of very little consequence instead of spending precious parliamentary time on something of significance.

attributes.action: Scrap 9-1 GCSE's for the current year 10 (leaving in 2k17)
attributes.background: The current year 10 in the UK will have a mixture of letters and numbers for their GCSE's and they are having huge levels of pressure to complete the syllabus for english and maths on time and revise before sitting the exams.
attributes.additional_details: At some schools, students are stressing because they will not be able to study and revise well enough in the short period of time. If the 9-1 GCSE's are not running for the current year 10's 2k16, then it will reduce the stress of students not getting very high grades

attributes.action: Call For A 2nd EU Referendum If A Good EU Withdrawal Agreement Cannot Be Made
attributes.background: The United Kingdom voting to leave the European Union triggers Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty. We want to decide if we should remain part of the European Union based upon the nature of the withdrawal agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
A Brexit triggers Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty. The European Council will conclude the this withdrawal arrangement based upon a qualified majority vote. A large portion of the United Kingdom electorate were misled into believing a favourable withdrawal agreement is relatively certain. 

We believe in informed democracy. We believe that we the British people should be able to decide whether or not our country leaves the EU based upon facts that we can confirm. Not contingent truths.

attributes.action: Introduce minimum professional qualifications for marketing services in the UK.
attributes.background: Considering the damage that poor advice or deliberate mis-selling of marketing services can do to our local & regional economies, it's time minimum professional qualifications were introduced to ensure protection for SME's across the UK. Greater accountability in marketing & advertising is required.

attributes.action: Voting Results Transparency Through An Update of the Voting System
attributes.background: We call for an updated voting system, British people register once, when the time comes to vote they take a unique identifier with them to a local polling station where they can log onto an electronic terminal and submit their vote. The public should be able to view all the votes for transparency.
attributes.additional_details: Many will argue their anonymity will be breached through transparency, however this very anonymity has the potential to be used, to manipulate the general public to remain in a closed and unknown voting system, where the possibility of corruption of votes will remain. Transparency removes uncertainty and creates trust, a notion that perhaps will restore a small portion of much needed faith in our countries politics.

attributes.action: England to have a bank holiday every 1st Monday of every month.
attributes.background: We as a nation are overworked. We do not spend enough time enjoying the little things in life with the people that matter.

attributes.action: Present only balanced arguments to the public for country wide referendums
attributes.background: There are so many factors that go into something like the EU referendum and so many points of view, from infinitely many sources, that facts are lost/blurred in a "shouting match" between parties attempting to court our vote with ill or misinformed information.
attributes.additional_details: Using the EU referendum as an example again, we see too many "scare tactics" presented openly as "fact" by both leave and remain campaigners. This has led to many of us being left confused and feeling like we are backing the party with the loudest voice. I think one of two things would help everyone if another situation such as this should arise; either campaigns should always be presented with for AND against points equally or an independent analyst should present one document with all FACTS.

attributes.action: Increase winter fuel payments and make them taxable.
attributes.background: This is a universal benefit but is not paid to pensioners living in the EU. A precedent that this benefit is not universal but is paid on the basis of need. Thus it should be either taxed or means tested. It cannot be different rules for UK pensioners who choose to live in the EU.

attributes.action: Stop birth certificate stating "Father Unknown" when the father doesn't register
attributes.background: When registering a babies birth, if the father is not in attendance, either by being unwilling or unable, the father is shown on the certificate as Unknown. I find this unacceptable as it suggests the mother is promiscuous. Please remove the word Unkown and leave blank or allow Unwilling.

attributes.action: All Police to be equipped with Naloxone kits to save lives
attributes.background:
Naloxone is a medication used to block the effects of opioids, especially in overdose.

I have provided a link to show how many Police Departments in America carry Naloxone and times it has saved lives. 

http://www.nchrc.org/law-enforcement/us-law-enforcement-who-carry-naloxone/

attributes.action: Impose age ratings on music videos using the same system used for films.
attributes.background: Some music videos (such as Rihanna's "Better Have My Money" video) contain themes (i.e. glorified cruelty, drug use and nudity) which are inappropriate for children but have no age restrictions.
attributes.additional_details: Parents can't always stop their children from watching videos like this as it can be shown to them by school friends, and or watched on their phones and iPads. It is not always possible for parents to know, and control, what their children are watching. And these videos can be watched by children as young as primary school age. Please sign this petition and help stop this.

attributes.action: Lower the cost or remove the cost of PRS & PPL Licensing
attributes.background: Many people over the years has been paying mega amount for a piece of paper that will allow you to create an online radio station. The costs per year vary from £545 - £2000. Myself and others think it should be removed in general. Let young people run a station without the fear of getting a fine!

attributes.action: Reduce funding for the BBC by the production cost of the new Top Gear.
attributes.background: The new format of Top Gear does not show value for money for the UK TV Licence payer. The new format is focused on capturing the US market and the revenue it can receive. The BBC should then have the cost of the new format production reduced from it's annual funding.
attributes.additional_details: The new format of Top Gear does not show value for money for the UK TV Licence payer. The new format is focused on capturing the US market and the revenue it can receive. This is in effect is commercial TV and therefore should not have to be funded by the public purse. The BBC should then have the cost of the new format production reduced from it's annual funding until a UK audience based format is produced for the UK TV Licence payer.

attributes.action: Parliament to change the law, to require the votes of MPs to be published.
attributes.background:
To stop MPs verbally stating their intention to vote one way but voting another.
Also, to highlight "tactical" voting and to give clarity to the electorate.

attributes.action: Raise tuition fees please.
attributes.background: Tuition fees are far too low and students are getting off easy. Please raise them!
attributes.additional_details: Raise them.

attributes.action: Stop motor insurers voiding innocent drivers' insurance policies
attributes.background: After a non-fault road traffic accident where my spine was injured, I received notice that my insurance was to be voided due to inadvertent (or innocent) non-disclosure of material fact.  The insurer could have checked the details for free at any time, but waited til I claimed.
attributes.additional_details:
There are multiple cases where the insurer is voiding policies after a claim is made.  My argument is that they are collecting "Golden Tickets", where they let you pay a policy until they are liable for something, so removing all risk

- They have a responsibility to check the details when it is free to do so.
- They shouldn't void insurance for trivial date mix-ups on policy, but rewrite/update instead.
- After non-fault incidents insurers shouldn't be allowed to throw the claimant to the wall.

attributes.action: Call for greater public scrutiny of how police forces are spending public money
attributes.background: Following the Hillsborough verdict, where 96 people died, greater scrutiny and reform is required to look at how public money is spent by the police to defend themselves and cover up their failure and mistakes. The Hillsborough victims’ families were denied the truth and struggled 27 yrs for justice
attributes.additional_details: The current system is unfair, unequal/bias against the victims and their families who deserve justice. Scrutiny and reform is required to monitor and stop those in the police and across our public services abusing public money to cover up their failures. The Hillsborough disaster proves how deep the covering up goes and how those in our public services do not admit their guilt but continue to pervert the course of justice. The government must act to hold those who abuse public funds accountable

attributes.action: Abolish the harsh new curriculum for secondary students!
attributes.background: The new secondary school curriculum is long, harsh and pointless. The amount of work and stress students put in does not equate to what students get out. The new tests take much more of students time and limits basic life skills such as team working.
attributes.additional_details: Lets bring back fairness to our education system, with your help we will!

attributes.action: Legislate that employers must publish how many professional roles are part time
attributes.background: The aim is to encourage large companies to offer more senior part time or job share work, to mirror the public sector where many such roles are available, e.g. teachers and doctors.  More transparency should help inclusion, and lead to a better gender balance at senior levels in the private sector.
attributes.additional_details:
For many women their career is over when they have a family as they want to return to their profession more flexibly but no jobs are available. The private sector needs to mirror the public sector where many opportunities are available. 
They will then be able to utilise the skills of women they have trained for much longer and this will lead to more women in senior roles.
This is timely with the new legislation regarding equal pay.
We understand that some senior roles can't be done part time.

attributes.action: Stop volunteers doing mock interviews in schools, use paid Career Coaches
attributes.background:
action to promote consistent and proactive approach to career  coaching in schools /colleges. 
Each student to receive a career coaching programme to suit.
Mock interviews depends who is "interviewing". coaches should be paid for their skills and talents.
attributes.additional_details:
Coaching is not a career advisor  in another guise, most people have bad memories of advice in schools and the advice was useless for  most people.
Career Coaching is about the individual.

attributes.action: Include peer-to-peer lending activities within the remit of the FSCS
attributes.background:
Peer-to-peer lending activities are not presently covered by the FSCS. The sector is regulated by the FCA however and many peer-to-peer lending platforms have set up internal reserve funds - further information may be found at http://innovativefinanceisa.org.uk/
The FSCS should be extended.

attributes.action: Change the spent conviction guideline for under 18s that turn 18 while on remand
attributes.background: People that are under 18 while on remand waiting for a plea date at court that turn 18 in the mean time are still convicted as an adult even though they was under 18 at the time of the offence commited help me change it so many more will have a chance of not reoffending and more likely to get a job.
attributes.additional_details: make the system more fare, give young offenders a fighting chance to turn their life's around when realised from prison. They wouldn't have to disclose there convictions for a ridiculous amount of time like adults do which isn't fare because they was under 18 at the time they commited the offence giving them much more of a chance obtaining a job or even a career. Why make it that much harder for them to turn their life's around. Do we Want kids still reoffending as adults?? Help break the cycle.

attributes.action: Stop police seizing vehicles that are fully legitimate with tax, mot, insurance
attributes.background: There's no protection for road users as explained and they find themselves being deprived of property and inconvenienced for no reason. This is mainly due to incompetent practice. The siezure of a vehicle should be on a factual basis and not suspicion or belief.
attributes.additional_details: The current law allows vehicles to be seized on the basis of just suspicion. The suspicion could turnout to be wrong but in the mean time seizures still take place even if the law abiding road user is at no fault of theirs. This is clearly unfair and could go as far as breaching your human rights. This procedure is a form of theft. Police have phones and access to the MID database to establish facts. It should be only fair that this procedure is followed before seizure is taken place. can u make it a law that police must prove vehicles have no insurance before siezing

attributes.action: Call upon the government to provide a healthy food subsidy
attributes.background: Make the government responsible for health food subsidy to help combat obesity

attributes.action: Stop calling the rise in minimum wage the living wage as it clearly isn't.
attributes.background: The Tory party and now all the media have fallen in to a trap of calling the 50P rise in the minimum wage as the living wage. It is not the living wage and calling it such devalues the living wage.

attributes.action: Abolish The Houses of Parliament/Lords in favour of local Regional Assemblies.
attributes.background:
Staying in the European Community inevitably means more legislation being passed by the European Parliament that will supersede our sovereign legislation leaving our legislature as merely  nodding donkeys.
The money saved by closure of both houses is colossal with the saved money put to better use.

attributes.action: Abolish the use of whole life sentences in England and Wales
attributes.background: Whole life sentences mean that a prisoner is effectively condemned to stay in prison until they die. There are about 8,000 prisoners serving life sentences in England and Wales, and at least 60 of those are serving whole life sentences.
attributes.additional_details: Nobody can predict when a prisoner will die, and in many cases they will reach an age where they will be no threat to society. And it has been proven in the past that even some of the worst criminals can rehabilitate and therefore qualify for parole. And what incentive do they have to behave in prison if they have no realistic hope of parole? Several such prisoners have behaved very violently in prison,  injuring other inmates, and one even committed further killings in prison.

attributes.action: raise issue of election with the Zimbabwean gov &/or the international community
attributes.background: Asking the UK government to help raise the issue about re election in Zimbabwe because there needs to be a strong change in order to reduce poverty, lower unemployment rates, pay civil servants and better the health care

attributes.action: Make the buying age of tobacco products 16+.
attributes.background:
The minimum age was 16 years of prior to 1994. 
Plus we can smoke at 16 but not buy it? this makes no sense and needs to be changed asap.

attributes.action:
Remove the UK from membership of the UN.
This organisation has become a pariah.
attributes.background: The UN has presided over countless deaths of civilians over the years and has lost its way in the new world of aggression where all countries seek are weapons and power. We need a court like system, signed up to by all with real penalties for transgressors.
attributes.additional_details:
I offer history as a witness and evidence. Name one conflict resolved by the UN?
It has become clear since the 1960's that the UN is an organisation mired in politics and self interest. The rules created for countries to debate are being abused in a wholesale and cynical fashion. Their must be a better way by way of a court which member states adhere to or else they are dismissed from the organisation. The bailiffs of the court will be member countries having no interest in the actions at hand and able to use full force to achieve the edicts of the  court. No more should soldiers stand by and witness rape, murder and torture. No more should cynical members be able to abuse the courts decisions with a veto.

attributes.action: Scrap HS2, and build the best internet system in the world instead.
attributes.background: HS2 makes no difference to the vast majority and solves old world issues. The disruption over a long period make the cost uncertain, with little benefit to the vast majority of the public and industry. Let's build the very best internet instead and make the UK the worlds leading tech nation instead!
attributes.additional_details:
Fixing overcrowded railways will turn out way same as fixing overcrowded motorways, the more you build the more crowded they become. With driverless cars around the corner, let's jump a stage ahead and move commercial traffic to the railway system and focus on making commercial communication better with the best internet the world has seen so far.
We and the next wave of innovators would all benefit from the side effect of hyper fast and super efficient internet in ways not even thought of yet.

attributes.action: To make it more financially beneficial to work than it is to claim benefits!
attributes.background:
Being on benefits is easy! I believe it should be  made hard, and the more you work, the better rewarded you are! 

As a single parent, I want to work, have a better life and be a good role model. But the more I work, the less I have! It's so wrong!

attributes.action: £500 tax allowance,every 4 yrs for sport for either membership fee or equipment.
attributes.background: To capitalize on the excitement of the Olympics, every 4 yrs a £500 tax free allowance per person could be allocated to spend on  either sports membership (golf for an example) or sport equipment. This will prevent certain sports being only available to the well off.

attributes.action: Reduce the working day to 6 hours with the same salary.
attributes.background:
Companies in Sweden have reduced the working hours of their employees to six hours, reporting happier staff, a lower turnover rate, and an increase in profits in that time.

Who doesn't want to spend more time with their friends and family, whilst also being more motivated and productive at work?
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/sweden-introduces-six-hour-work-day-a6674646.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/the-six-hour-work-day-increases-productivity-so-will-britain-and-america-adopt-one-sweden-a7066961.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-34677949

attributes.action: 10 year automatic sentence for carrying a knife
attributes.background: Anyone caught carrying a knife should be given a standard 10 year jail sentence.

attributes.action: Get rid of the EU flag on cars number plates in Britain
attributes.background: Why is the EU flag on car number plates? It doesn't seem necessary, just a branding from a union trying to control us
attributes.additional_details: There is no need for the European Union to be branded on our cars anyway, I don't see a need for it. It's like the EU will do what ever it takes to claim as much as possible in Europe, they want to own everything! they're turning into the supreme rulers of Europe under our noses controlling us and claiming us as their own We are UK citizens!! our government is a prime minister not a President! and definitely not an EU one!!

attributes.action: Increase wage for qualified level 3 nursery assistants and early years educators
attributes.background: Nursery assistants and early years educators follow the same EYFS targets as a reception class teacher. We are now required to have specified knowledge of children's learning and development. It is no longer 'just' childcare. We are teachers.
attributes.additional_details: Nursery Assistants and early years educators perform a similar job to that of a reception class teacher. We must ensure children are learning and developing at a rate deemed age appropriate. We must carry out rergular assessments on the children, and facilitate learning environments and activities based on each individual childs needs. We need to have in depth knowledge of the Early Years Foundation Stage and are usually required to be qualified.

attributes.action: Review the exempted conditions and ages for NHS prescription charges
attributes.background:
The list of exempt conditions and age limits have not been reviewed and inequalities now exist.
1. Some life-long life-threatening conditions make sufferers eligible for free prescriptions even when not related to their condition, others receive no support.
2. The age limit of 60 is out of date.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Some of the biggest killers are not currently covered by exemptions such as heart disease. This can mean that people may miss medication to keep them well.
2. The current system encourages those exempt to visit a Dr to obtain prescriptions for minor illnesses when medication is available over the counter. This costs the NHS time and money.
3. As retirement ages increase and people are working longer it is logical that other benefits should remain aligned to the same age.

attributes.action: Completely change the old system of education we have today.
attributes.background: Uk needs a modern integral education based on the talents and abilities of students; so that when they finish secondary they know three languages and have a defined job. Children 0-6 years will learn playing, 7-11 years will learn practicing at school, 12-16 years will learn practicing in companies.
attributes.additional_details: The education be taught with computers and practices they will be guided by specialized teachers in each area; so that at years a child will be in the ability to program a computer and at 12 years he will have a profession. With the new system of education in the 21st century; let's educate for entrepreneurs to be those that produce jobs and not like the old traditional education, which teaches to create simple employees. We are going to take advantage of the new technologies and scientific advances to integrally educated and with high quality our children, who are the future of the Nation.

attributes.action: Scrap Tax on Savings Income altogether, NOT just the 1st £1000
attributes.background: As Interest rates on 'Savings Accounts' are at record lows currently, people are now struggling to live off their savings incomes, which the government taxes after the 1st £1000 income at 20%.
attributes.additional_details: The government can easily scrap this tax for savers, forever, in the next Budget, also, would save a lot of people having to complete the Self-Assessment to repay Savings Income above £1000.

attributes.action: Give British people a say in our post-referendum relationship with the EU
attributes.background: The EU referendum gave the option of leaving or remaining in the EU. The options in reality are more nuanced and there is a risk of the British populace getting an unsatisfactory outcome. Given the lies of the pre-referendum campaigning we need honesty about the future of Britain and further say.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to know, and have a say on:
Whether further austerity measures might be necessary after leaving the EU: www.just-fair.co.uk/#!United-Nations-Austerity-policies-breach-the-UK%E2%80%99s-international-human-rights-obligations/qbw0c/577384fa0cf231749dc9f955
How immigration will be affected www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-37271420
Whether the NHS will be better off by £350 million per week
Whether the United Kingdom will split up
How our successful science base will be protected

attributes.action: Ban group interviews for all job applicants in the UK
attributes.background:
In the harsh times we live in, employment and specifically, unemployment is one of the most painful things a person can face.
The indignity of group interviews where people are made to beg around a table for jobs, is unfair.
We need to empower jobseekers, not crush them and ban group interviews.
attributes.additional_details:
Group interviews are by many seen as a lazy recruitment practise, to root out 'unworthy' candidates quickly.
In many cases, I find group interviews to be discriminatory and unfair to certain demographics.
Paid employment is and should be for everyone.
One of the major flaws with group interviews is that introverted personality types are left out in the cold. 
We need to introduce a fairer system that forces employers to evenly and fairly judge ALL potential job candidates.

attributes.action: Change length of time that offences stay on a persons criminal record to 10 yrs
attributes.background: If an offence stays on your record for life you're punished for life. The law should be changed so that if no further crimes are committed after 10 years the offence should be removed from there basic record. Enhanced checks for work places with children/vulnerable adults should stay permanently.
attributes.additional_details: Any offence with a 30 month+ sentence stays on record for life regardless of the type of crime/number of offences committed. Yes people need to be punished for breaking the law but if there sentence is served and they commit no further crimes they should be able to move on and build a life. People cannot get jobs because of their record and end up re-offending, homeless and with mental health issues. Changing the law will reduce crime rates, improve peoples well-being.

attributes.action: Enable Police and Telephone services to trace and prosecute cold callers.
attributes.background: Cold calling is supposed to be illegal, TPS is not a deterrent, so the Police, trading Standards and Telephone service providers should be compelled to cooperate to trace, arrest, and prosecute offenders. A help line should be created for reporting offending numbers.
attributes.additional_details: In this digital world, it should be possible to trace who purchased any number. Citizens can bar withheld numbers to prevent some calls, but there is a problem with normal numbers. These must be held on record by service providers. They must be traceable to a specific location.

attributes.action: Ask this Government to consider issuing a medal to all serving armed forces.
attributes.background: I consider anyone serving their country for security and safety reasons should be acknowledged by means of a medal of service for their dedication and support to make this a safer and better World for us all to live and work in as a show of appreciation.

attributes.action: start a national lottery to run health service
attributes.background: save our health service

attributes.action: Make smoking any substance/cigarette illegal in the UK.
attributes.background: This is a very strong point I feel needs to be raised as the damage caused to bodies and minds from smoking is dangerous and worrying. It rips away at your organs and also influences children and young adults to smoke as they will begin to think it is an okay and unharmful thing to do.
